str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Plural
str2: To put to death, kill; fig: I abolish. From apo and kteino; to kill outright; figuratively, to destroy.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a compound of pro and phemi; a foreteller; by analogy, an inspired speaker; by extension, a poet.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Plural
str2: From ek and dioko; to pursue out, i.e. Expel or persecute implacably.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Plural
str2: To please, with the idea of willing service rendered to others; hence almost: I serve. Probably from airo; to be agreeable.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
Opposite, opposed, contrary; the adversary. From enanti; opposite; figuratively, antagonistic.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.
